summary: Nutria, also known as coypu, are large, plant-eating rodents from South America. They live near water and burrow into the banks. Nutria were brought to North America, Europe, and Asia for their fur, but they cause problems by digging holes and eating plants. They are now considered harmful "invasive species" in many places. Nutria can also spread diseases to people and animals through water.
title: Nutria
